argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | ra4.1 | |- F/ x ph |
| 2 |  | #P_df-ral | |- ( A. x e. A ( ph -> ps ) <-> A. x ( x e. A -> ( ph -> ps ) ) ) |
| 3 |  | #P_bi2.04 | |- ( ( x e. A -> ( ph -> ps ) ) <-> ( ph -> ( x e. A -> ps ) ) ) |
| 4 | 3 | #P_albii | |- ( A. x ( x e. A -> ( ph -> ps ) ) <-> A. x ( ph -> ( x e. A -> ps ) ) ) |
| 5 | 2, 4 | #P_bitri | |- ( A. x e. A ( ph -> ps ) <-> A. x ( ph -> ( x e. A -> ps ) ) ) |
| 6 | 1 | #P_stdpc5 | |- ( A. x ( ph -> ( x e. A -> ps ) ) -> ( ph -> A. x ( x e. A -> ps ) ) ) |
| 7 | 5, 6 | #P_sylbi | |- ( A. x e. A ( ph -> ps ) -> ( ph -> A. x ( x e. A -> ps ) ) ) |
| 8 |  | #P_df-ral | |- ( A. x e. A ps <-> A. x ( x e. A -> ps ) ) |
| 9 | 7, 8 | #P_syl6ibr | |- ( A. x e. A ( ph -> ps ) -> ( ph -> A. x e. A ps ) ) |
\
 Restricted quantifier version of Axiom 5 of [Mendelson] p. 69.  This is the axiom ~ stdpc5 of standard predicate calculus for a restricted domain.  See ~ ra4v for a version requiring fewer axioms.  (Contributed by NM, 16-Jan-2004.)  Obsolete version of ~ ra4 as of 25-Mar-2020. (New usage is discouraged.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.)
